name: n-hexyl acetate
Reason: 1,3-dioxolane has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for comparison is n-hexane, which has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the acetate group (O=C(C)OCCCCCC) increases the melting point due to the presence of a carbonyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and form a more rigid structure. The methyl group (C) adds approximately +10 due to the increase in molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding. The hexyl group (CCCCCC) adds approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding. The dioxane-like bridging moiety (O=C(C)OCCCCCC) adds approximately +5 due to the increase in molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding.
